fields.headline: Filter tip
fields.bodyText: The new health secretary can make a major contribution to public health by banning smoking in all enclosed public places (Leaders, June 2). Patricia Hewitt must move on from John Reid's proposals to allow smoking in non-food pubs. Your leader said that 85% of pubs serve food, but the British Medical Association's recent survey, Booze, Fags and Food, showed that in Leeds, for example, 88% of pubs are non-food; many council officers told the BMA that the government's smoke-free proposals were unworkable. Hewitt should show the courage that politicians in Scotland and Ireland have, and ban smoking in all enclosed public places. Dr Vivienne Nathanson BMA head of science and ethics
